snippet: Skills honed on behalf of President Bashar al-Assad will be used for militia groups battling the Sunnis who are driving toward Baghdad.
abstract: Shiites respond by the thousands to call to arms issued by Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani to protect fellow Shiites and to prop up Shiite government of Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki; strong response is in part due to fact that Shiites feel that they are on verge of squandering opportunity to rule in Iraq; reliance on Shiite militias to combat Islamic State in Iraq and Syria fighters raises chilling memories of sectarian war that raged there from 2005 to 2008.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ROD NORDLAND

lead_paragraph: Skills honed on behalf of President Bashar al-Assad will be used for militia groups battling the Sunnis who are driving toward Baghdad.

headline.main: Seeing Their Gains at Risk, Shiites Flock to Join Militias
headline.print_headline: Seeing Their Gains at Risk, Shiites Flock to Join Militias

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
